meanings.definition: Economical or frugal in the use or expenditure of something.
meanings.sent1: She was very sparing with her allowance, saving most of it for a rainy day.
meanings.sent2: The family lived a sparing lifestyle, always looking for ways to save money.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's sparing collection of acorns made the other animals wonder if it was planning a feast.
meanings.sent4: Her sparing use of paint on the canvas created a striking and minimalist artwork.
meanings.sent5: The sparing use of spices in the dish allowed the natural flavors to shine through.

meanings.definition: Scanty or meager in amount or quantity.
meanings.sent1: The old man had a sparing amount of food left in his pantry.
meanings.sent2: The plant struggled to grow in the sparing soil of the desert.
meanings.sent3: The sparing attendance at the event disappointed the organizers.
meanings.sent4: Her sparing collection of books surprised her friends who expected a full library.
meanings.sent5: The sparing rainfall in the region led to a drought and crop failure.

meanings.definition: To refrain from harming or destroying; to show mercy or compassion.
meanings.sent1: He was sparing with his criticism, always trying to be kind in his feedback.
meanings.sent2: The knight spared the dragon, showing a rare act of sparing in the midst of battle.
meanings.sent3: The cat spared the mouse, deciding to play with it instead of catching it.
meanings.sent4: She spared the spider in the corner, feeling a sense of sparing towards all creatures.
meanings.sent5: The king's sparing of the prisoner's life brought hope to the kingdom.
